Fig. 3. Task analysis with analytical tasks in rows. Black cells indicate that the dimension in column is involved. “Data” indicates if the required data is available for a task. “Data type” columns indicate which kind of data is required. “Corresponding low-level task” columns are the low-level tasks from Amar et al.’s taxonomy [2]. “Corresponding interaction” columns are Yi et al.’s interaction categories [37] that we implemented in TimeSpan.
